definition: to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful

sentences.english: So let us seize it, not in fear,but in gladness.
sentences.chinese: 因此，让我们毫无畏惧，满心愉悦地把握命运。

sentences.english: For him to take that opportunity - he deserves a lot of respect for that.
sentences.chinese: 他则把握了那些机会，他配得上这些尊重。

sentences.english: The author studied the standard of naming the comedian in a variety show in the light of the historical development.
sentences.chinese: 本文以历史发展的眼光去把握俳优的定名。

sentences.english: Life is not a dream, destiny is held in our own hands.
sentences.chinese: 浮生并非若梦，命运还靠自己把握。

sentences.english: Goldman is coining it again for two reasons.
To the life of the watershed, and in the test with the experience and to grasp.
sentences.chinese: 到了人生的分水岭了，在考验与历练中去把握。

sentences.english: My elder sister, take care of yourself and master the direction of your eudemonia .
sentences.chinese: 师姐，你要把握好幸福的方向，照顾好自己。

sentences.english: I wish I were more certain.
sentences.chinese: 我希望自己能够更有把握一些。
自我感觉如何全看你如何把握。

sentences.english: One way Ersan scores is to get second chance points.
sentences.chinese: 厄桑的一个得分利器就是能够把握二次进攻得分。

sentences.english: In the game of love, as in comedy, timing, they say, is everything.
sentences.chinese: 他们说爱情游戏就跟喜剧一样，时机的把握就是一切。

sentences.english: His argument does not get to the heart of the topic.
sentences.chinese: 他的这篇议论文并没有把握住主题的肯綮。

sentences.english: Nesw reality is important for net media's truth.
sentences.chinese: 把握好新闻的真实性，关系到网络媒体的公信力。

sentences.english: In a broader grasp of the direction of the small but has ignored.
sentences.chinese: 在大处把握了方向，小处却有所忽视。

sentences.english: As the past has faded into misty memories, and the future remains a dream unrealized, seizing the present is most important.
sentences.chinese: 过去已成虚幻，未来尚是梦想，把握现在最重要。

sentences.english: There are several students in our class who are still not sure about the use of attributive classes.
sentences.chinese: 我们班上还有好多学生对定语从句的用法仍没有把握。

definition: to grasp (often fig.)/to control/to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny)/to master/to know well/to understand sth well and know how to use it/fluency
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
to change according to the situation (idiom); pragmatic
